## Regret Analysis

- A player chooses an action ${\theta}^{(t)}\in K$ every $t$ period. K is a feasible set of actions.

- The cost function $f^{(t)}$ determines the cost $f^{(t)}(\theta^{(t)})$ for action $\theta^{(t)}$.

- The player decides his action based on strategy.
